title: Project for Developing a Diagnostic Tool for High School Students' Readiness for Independent Online Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic online learning platform usage, self-directed learning experience
context.additional_context: Science majors experience developing self-assessment tools through project-based learning, utilizing personal devices for online collaboration and data analysis

learning_goals: The reliability and validity of a 36-item self-assessment tool for measuring readiness for independent online learning can be validated.
One can explain the process of evaluating the discriminatory power of tools developed using PLS analysis.
One can propose a plan to apply a tool for diagnosing high school students' adaptation levels to online learning environments in actual educational contexts.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
